page.title: 04HOUSING
page.content:
THERE ARE A VARIETY OF NEW HOUSES WHICH HAVE BEEN BUILT OVER THE LAST FEW YEARS WITH AN ESTATE OF ABOUT 25 HOUSES AT LT FRANSHAM CALLED LIME TREE CRESCENT AND A CUL-DE-SAC OF BUNGALOWS NEAR THE STATION, ALTHOUGH THIS HAS SINCE BEEN CLOSED DOWN.
SINGLE HOUSES HAVE BEEN BUILT AND MANY OLD PROPERTIES HAVE BEEN - AND ARE STILL BEING - RENOVATED, BUT GENERALLY BUILDING IS KEPT TO A MINIMUM TO MAINTAIN THE COUNTRY VILLAGE QUALITY.
THE LOCAL FARMS HAVE A NUMBER OF TIED HOUSES AND THERE ARE THREE SMALL COUNCIL ESTATES, ONE AT BEESTON AND TWO AT LITTLE FRANSHAM.
